intro: Galium nitidulum var. scabriusculum, commonly known as rough-stemmed bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It features slender, ascending stems covered with short, stiff hairs, giving it a rough texture. The leaves are opposite, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a slightly hairy surface. Small white flowers are borne in clusters at the leaf axils, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. This plant is commonly found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
